main

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Command

  • public class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    The main.Command class is used to track the commands used to control a given turtle. The initalization requires either an ArrayList of inputs or a string with valid commands seperated with newlines. This keeps track of the current command, and has a method for getting the next LocationChange object for movement.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string containing all the commmands
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String containing all commands

      • addCommands

        public void addCommands(java.lang.String commandString)
        Add commands from a String which has commands separated by newlines. If given an empty string, it will default to not moving. If one or more command is invalid, its line number will be added to the invalidCommandLineNumber array for display of errors.
        Parameters:
        commandString - A String of valid commands, separated by newlines, which will be added on to the Command iteration.

      • getInvalidCommandLineNumber

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getInvalidCommandLineNumber()
        Return the invalid command line number, which will be an empty ArrayList if all the entered commands are valid.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of integers corresponding to the line numbers of invalid commands.

      • validateCommand

        public boolean validateCommand(java.lang.String input)
        Will check to see if a single command input is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        input - the single command to be validated
        Returns:
        true if the command is valid, false if it isn't.

      • generateLocationChange

        public LocationChange generateLocationChange(java.lang.String input)
        Given a single input, will create a new LocationChange object with either a move or a turn.
        Parameters:
        input - A single valid input, either move or turn
        Returns:
        a LocationChange object translating the command into a number of degrees of turning or a number of steps of movement.

      • getNextLocation

        public LocationChange getNextLocation()
        Go through the Commands in order, and return the next LocationChange object in the sequence. Will loop back to the beginning upon reaching the end of the Commands.
        Returns:
        LocationChange object corresponding to the next change.

      • resetCommands

        public void resetCommands()
        Reset the Command object.

      • getCommandInputs

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCommandInputs()
        Get the ArrayList of String inputs.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Strings corresponding to the command inputs
